str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
No one, none, nothing.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
